metadata.title: CVE-2009-0146 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the JBIG2 decoder in Xpdf 3.02pl2 and earlier,CUPS 1.3.9 and earlier, and other products allow remote attackers to causea denial of service (crash) via a crafted PDF file, related to (1)JBIG2SymbolDict::setBitmap and (2) JBIG2Stream::readSymbolDictSeg.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-0146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-2
No subscription required

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
libpoppler52 - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.10.5-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-2').
poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.5-1ubuntu2').
